title: Care Personally
summary: Show genuine concern for your colleagues as people, not just as employees.

details.content: Building trust and strong relationships is foundational for effective communication and feedback. People are more receptive to candor when they know you care about them as individuals.
Take time to ask about a team member’s well-being or family, and remember important details about their lives.

content: Check in regularly with colleagues about non-work topics.
Listen actively and empathetically.
Remember and acknowledge important events in others’ lives.
Offer support during difficult times.

title: Challenge Directly
summary: Give clear, honest feedback—even when it’s uncomfortable.

details.content: Direct challenges help people grow and improve. Avoiding tough conversations can lead to misunderstandings and stagnation.
Tell a colleague directly when their work doesn’t meet expectations, while also expressing your confidence in their ability to improve.

content: Be specific about what needs to change.
Focus on behaviors, not personalities.
Balance honesty with respect.
Prepare for the conversation but be open to dialogue.

title: Solicit Feedback
summary: Actively seek input on your own performance and behavior.

details.content: Inviting feedback demonstrates humility and a willingness to grow. It also models the behavior you want to see in others.
Ask your team, 'What’s one thing I could do better?' after a meeting or project.

content: Ask open-ended questions about your impact.
Listen without interrupting or defending.
Thank people for their honesty.
Act on the feedback you receive.

title: Give Praise
summary: Recognize and celebrate others’ achievements and positive behaviors.

details.content: Positive reinforcement encourages repeat behaviors and boosts morale. Genuine praise builds trust and motivation.
Publicly acknowledge a team member’s creative solution to a challenging problem.

content: Be specific about what you’re praising.
Deliver praise promptly.
Make it personal and sincere.
Balance public and private recognition based on the individual’s preference.

title: Give Criticism
summary: Offer constructive feedback to help others improve.

details.content: Constructive criticism is essential for growth and development. When delivered with care, it helps people correct course and reach their potential.
Privately let a colleague know that their recent report was unclear, and suggest ways to improve clarity next time.

content: Be timely and specific.
Focus on actions and outcomes, not character.
Offer suggestions for improvement.
Check in after to support progress.

title: Gauge Reactions
summary: Observe and respond to how others react to your feedback.

details.content: Understanding others’ responses helps you adjust your approach and ensures your message is received as intended.
Notice if a team member becomes defensive or withdrawn after feedback, and follow up to clarify your intentions.

content: Watch for verbal and nonverbal cues.
Ask clarifying questions if someone seems upset.
Be willing to revisit the conversation.
Adjust your style based on individual needs.

title: Encourage Growth
summary: Support your colleagues’ development and career aspirations.

details.content: Helping others grow fosters engagement, loyalty, and high performance. People thrive when they feel supported in their ambitions.
Help a team member identify stretch assignments or training opportunities aligned with their goals.

content: Discuss career aspirations regularly.
Provide resources and opportunities for learning.
Offer mentorship or coaching.
Celebrate progress and milestones.
